html:
If you’re looking at opening a new bank account or getting a new credit card, bank bonuses and promotions can help you land some free money in the process.

Many banks, such as Truist Bank, offer seasonal and ongoing bonuses and offers, covering both personal as well as business consumers.

I have personally held Truist consumer bank accounts in the past and have completed some of the bonuses listed below.

Truist tends to offer bonuses on both their consumer and business products and are rather generous with the amounts as they look to grow their deposit base since merging SunTrust and BB&T to form Truist.

Current Truist Bank Bonuses

Here is the list of the current Truist promotions and bonuses that you can take advantage of today:

  • Truist One Checking: $400 Bonus
  • Truist Small Business Checking: $400 Bonus
  • Truist Enjoy Travel credit card: 20,000 Bonus Miles

Truist One Checking: $400 Bonus

Truist is offering a lucrative $400 bonus for new accountholders that open a Truist One Checking personal checking account.

Taking advantage of this offer is easy, but it expires April 30, 2025

Requirements:

  1. Open a Truist One Checking consumer checking account
  2. Make at least 2 qualifying direct deposits totaling at least $1,000 within 90 days

The qualifying checking account must be opened online and have a mailing address in: AL, AR, FL, GA, IN, KY, MD, MS, NC, NJ, OH, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA, WV or DC

Continue Reading:

  • Best FREE Checking Accounts

Truist Small Business Checking: $400 Bonus

Truist is offering a lucrative $400 bonus for accountholders that open a Truist Simple Business Checking or Dynamic Business Checking account.

Many business checking accounts require a lot of cash to earn the bonus; however, Truist only requires a relative small deposit on hand.

The business’s physical address must be in: AL, AR, FL, GA, IN, KY, MD, MS, NC, NJ, OH, PA, SC, TN, TX, VA, WV or DC

Offer expires March 31, 2025

Truist Enjoy Travel credit card: 20,000 Bonus Miles

The Truist Enjoy Travel credit card is actually a pretty good card.

It rivals some of the larger American Express and Chase powerhouses in terms of the perks and earning potential, but comes with NO ANNUAL FEE.

Not only can you get rewards faster than with other cards, but there’s also an ongoing promotion that can see you get as many as 20,000 bonus miles.

These points have a cash redemption value of $200.

Requirements:

  1. Apply for and get the Truist Enjoy Travel credit card
  2. Make $1,500 worth of purchases within the first three months of opening the account

Here’s a look at the current rewards earning structure:

  • Earn 2x miles per $1 spent on airfare, car rentals, and hotels.
  • Earn 1x miles per $1 spent on all other eligible purchases.
  • Plus, a statement credit up to $85 for TSA PreCheck® or Global Entry® fee is awarded once every four years.

You’ll also earn a 10% – 50% Loyalty Travel Bonus based on your Truist deposit relationship when you redeem your rewards for travel through the rewards program.

There is more good news as any points you earn also do not expire for as long as the account remains open.

FAQs

What are bank bonuses?

Bank bonuses are cash rewards and other perks the bank gives to its customers for meeting specific criteria.

In most cases, these involve depositing a certain amount of new money into a new account and holding it there for some time.

There are several reasons why a bank does this. These reasons can include anything from attracting new customers to rewarding customers that have been with the bank for a very long time.

Either way, taking advantage of these bonuses on offer can see you get extra cash, which is always welcome.

What should I look out for?

While free money is always something to look forward to, it’s important to take note of the fine print that accompanies any sign-up bonus you’re thinking of taking.

Most promotions and bonuses require several direct deposits to be made into the account within so many days of opening the account (has to be a deposit by your employer or an outside agency).

The funds usually have to be kept in the deposit account for several months before you become eligible for the bonus.

Some offers are available online, while others are exclusively in-branch.

Do keep in mind that some accounts also have a fee that has to be paid every fee period, which is mostly set to monthly.

The applicable APR rate is another important point to take into consideration, especially the applicable rate once any introductory offers are over.

Ultimately, each promotion is subject to its own terms and conditions.

This makes it important to make sure you understand the restrictions and obligations surrounding each offer you want to take up.

All information should be available through the promotion page on the bank’s website. If you cannot find it, be sure to ask one of the bank’s representatives for a copy.

We will now look at the different bonuses on offer, how you can take advantage of them, and what other perks you can look forward to when opening a new Truist consumer account or business account.

Is A Truist Bank Bonus For You?

Truist is an excellent bank if you’re looking to open a new account while making your money go further by taking advantage of some bonus offer codes.

As with most bank bonuses, these are only available to new Truist customers.

So, for example, if you’re a current owner of a Truist consumer account, it is best to check with a customer service rep before applying for a new card or account so that you can be sure that you’ll definitely get the bonus.

Before opening a new bank account to claim any bonus, be sure to take the time to shop around.

Many card issuers are offering bonuses right now, but looking at the bonus requirements and eligibility criteria set by the bank can help you narrow it down to the ones that could really work for you.

Take the time to understand the eligibility requirements to avoid disappointment.

Some accounts also have a monthly service fee, but in most cases, this can be waived by meeting specific requirements.

Many banks around the country have ongoing and seasonal promotions, but you do have to be mindful of their expiration dates as they change frequently.
